{"id":956365866,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"2Â weeks","timestamp":1684922795,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"5418 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/956365866/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Perfect Squares","memory":"16.3 MB","code":"class Solution:\n    def numSquares(self, n: int) -> int:\n        if n<=3:\n            return n\n        \n        squares=[]\n        dp = [n]*(n+1)\n        dp[0],dp[1],dp[2],dp[3]=0,1,2,3\n\n        for i in range(n):\n            sq=i*i\n            if sq>n:\n                break\n            elif sq==n:\n                return 1\n            else:\n                dp[sq]=1\n                squares.append(sq)\n        \n        for i in range(4,n+1):\n            j=0\n            while j<len(squares) and squares[j]<=i:\n                dp[i]=min(dp[i],1+dp[i-squares[j]])\n                j+=1\n\n        return dp[n]\n\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"perfect-squares","has_notes":false}
